intro: Gnaphalium balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish to white composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gnaphalium balearicum is known for its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
